channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Prolonged confinement of prisoners could prompt legal action against Corrections
item.description: Corrections admits it has opened itself up to the possibility of legal action as it may have broken the law by confining women to their cells for more than 23 hours a day.

item.title: Comancheros trial: Police listened to gang's calls for months before raid, court told
item.description: Police bugged cellphones belonging to members and associates of the Comancheros gang, listening live to calls almost a year before raiding the bikies in a major bust.

item.title: Watercare granted consent to access extra 100 million litres a day from Waikato River
item.description: Watercare can take the extra allocation of water between May and September, and at other times of the year when the river is above median flow.

item.title: Diabetes group challenges Pharmac's limits on new drugs
item.description: A diabetes group is angry at Pharmac's proposal to limit new medicines to high risk people with type two diabetes.

item.title: Māori public health group worker tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: A Māori public health group in west Auckland has confirmed one of its employees has tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Watch: Health debate with Shane Reti and Chris Hipkins
item.description: National's Dr Shane Reti and Labour's Chris Hipkins join Checkpoint to discuss how we balance immediate needs in a health crisis against increasing longer term demands on the health dollar.

item.title: Child welfare groups campaign for better outcomes for tamariki
item.description: Four child welfare groups have today launched a campaign to ensure tamariki are front of mind for voters this election.

item.title: Ports of Auckland worker who died was father of seven
item.description: Auckland Council's Pasifika councillors say they are deeply saddened by the death of Pala'amo Kalati.

item.title: Changes to resident visas, border exceptions for those overseas
item.description: The government has announced it is adding more categories under which people can apply for border exceptions, along with changes to extend or renew residency visas for some stuck overseas.

item.title: Six new cases of Covid-19 in community linked to church, bus driver tests positive
item.description: Members of the Mt Roskill Evangelical Fellowship Church group are being asked to be re-tested and an Auckland bus driver has tested positive.

item.title: Surveillance to ramp up at ports with $50m cash boost for Customs
item.description: The government is ramping up customs surveillance at the country's ports, with the promise of a $50 million injection.

item.title: Family of man aboard sunken cattle ship still hope for his return
item.description: The family of missing New Zealander Lochie Bellerby are still hopeful for his safe return.

item.title: Rental car questionnaire for tourists 'wholly inadequate' - coroner
item.description: A mother whose son was killed by a foreign driver is welcoming a call for rental car companies to improve their driver assessments.

item.title: Decision on maternity care in Central Lakes set for November
item.description: The Southern DHB has been consulting on where to locate primary birthing units and maternity hubs in Central Otago and Wānaka since February.

item.title: Northern Express bus route details after driver tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: The bus takes passengers to and from stations on Auckland's North Shore and stops in the CBD, and more than 300 people used it at the time the driver was on shift. Here's the bus route and the timings.

item.title: Man charged with murder in Palmerston North after incident
item.description: Police in Palmerston North have charged a man with murder and launched a homicide investigation, following a man's death yesterday.

item.title: Hundreds lose Covid-19 relief payment, but no jobs in sight
item.description: Hundreds of people are coming off the government's 12-week Covid-19 income relief payment, without having found a new job.

item.title: Police seeking info on Invercargill aggravated robbery
item.description: Police are investigating an aggravated robbery at a business in Invercargill.
